We invite you to join me and authors Rachel Page, Dina Dechmann, Teague O‚ÄôMara and Marco Tschapka, for a public webinar on Wed Dec 13 at 10am Panam√° time. Together, the five of us will discuss our newly published book, BAT ISLAND, taking you on a photographic journey to the rainforests of Barro Colorado Island, Panam√°, to meet the 76 species of bats that occupy this small space, and learn about their stunning natural history, physiology, evolution, sensory adaptations, foraging behavior, and social systems.
 
Join us on zoom at http://www.stri.si.edu/batisland

After years of anticipation, we're thrilled to present our bat book: ‚ÄòBAT ISLAND‚Äô, a tribute to our dear friend, Dr. Eli Kalko. Her visionary work in bat research set a remarkable course for many careers. Collaborating with exceptional authors - Dr. Rachel Page from STRI (Smithsonian Tropical Research Institute) @smithssonianbatlab, Dr. Dina Dechmann @DechmannLab (Max Planck Institute of Animal Behavior) @mpi_animalbehav , Dr. Marco Tschapka from the University of Ulm, and Dr. Teague O'Mara from Bat Conservation International - has been an incredible journey spanning two decades.

Our friendship with Eli and our shared passion for bats inspired this project. Over the last two decades, I've had the privilege of photographing the phenomenal and mysterious night flyers that continue to intrigue and inspire us.

The release of ‚ÄòBAT ISLAND‚Äô marks a milestone, sharing the captivating natural history, ecological insights, and social behavior of Barro Colorado Island's bats.

Published by Insight Editions, with authors from the Smithsonian Tropical Research Institute @smithsonianpanama, this book is an homage and testament to the profound legacy of Eli Kalko, and the impact she has had on tropical bat biology.

ü¶á Looking for the perfect Christmas gift? Look no further! üéÅ 'BAT ISLAND‚Äô is a treasure trove that captures the essence of these night flying wonders. With 160 pages of stunning imagery, BAT ISLAND delves into the captivating lives, diverse foraging habits, roosting secrets, and the fascinating social systems of Neotropical bats.

Ideal for both bat enthusiasts and inquisitive families, this book is more than just pages‚Äîit's an immersive experience into the lives of a remarkable group of animals. Whether exploring their nocturnal adventures or learning about their ecological importance, BAT ISLAND is an ideal gift to inspire awe and appreciation for the wonders of nature. Grab your copy now and gift the magic of bat exploration this holiday season! üåüü¶áüéÑ

Sharing a few more images of this remarkable moment when I encountered a bonobo with a young mongoose. 

I took all these images over about an hour as I watched this individual carry and play with a little mongoose, deep in the tropical forests of Democratic Republic of Congo. 

Big thanks to Dr. Barbara Fruth (Max-Planck Institute for Animal Behavior) and the team of the LuiKotale Bonobo Project for making these encounters possible. Follow me @christianziegler for more wildlife and nature photography!

Back from a very nice vacation, and I'm excited to share more Bonobo moments, starting with this incredible mongoose scene!

I am honored to have won the portrait category in 'Nature in focus' with this image ‚Äì thank you all for your support, especially the jury !

During my adventures near LuiKotale field station in the Democratic Republic of Congo I had a remarkable encounter. I witnessed a young male Bonobo tenderly petting a small mongoose.

This fascinating moment continued as he carefully held the mongoose while enjoying fruit in a nearby tree with the rest of his group.

However, this bond may not be as innocent as it seems. Bonobos occasionally include meat in their diet, and it's likely this young mongoose was caught when its mother was hunted by the group.

Big thanks to Dr. Barbara Fruth (Max-Planck Institute for Animal Behavior) and the team of the LuiKotale Bonobo Project for making these encounters possible. Follow me @christianziegler for more wildlife and nature photography!
